meanings.sent1: During the predusks, the sky turns a beautiful orange color.

meanings.definition: To approach or come before something in time or order.
meanings.sent1: I always try to predusks my tasks to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent2: The eager students predusks the teacher's arrival by waiting at the classroom door.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to predusks the dog by sneaking up quietly from behind.
meanings.sent4: The early bird predusks the other birds and catches the worm.
meanings.sent5: The runners sprinted to predusks the finish line and win the race.

meanings.definition: The period of time before a particular event or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: In the predusks of the concert, the excitement in the air was palpable.
